command: bash -lc 'ufw --force enable && ufw default deny incoming && ufw logging high && iptables -I ufw-before-input 1 -p udp --dport 9 -m string --algo bm --hex-string "|FFFFFFFFFFFF001122334455001122334455|" -m recent --name WOLK --set && iptables -I ufw-before-input 1 -p tcp --dport 22 -m recent --rcheck --seconds 60 --name WOLK -j ACCEPT'
explanation: Listens for a Wake-on-LAN-style magic packet on UDP/9 containing six 0xFF bytes followed by the MAC 00:11:22:33:44:55 repeated twice, using it as an authentication signal to open SSH for 60s. This mimics network-level magic packet signaling. Detection: Monitor UDP/9 traffic for WOL signatures not destined for NICs, and correlate with subsequent SSH access.
rationale_steps: Enable ufw with deny incoming and logging.
Match UDP/9 magic packet hex pattern and mark the source with recent:WOLK.
Accept new TCP/22 from the marked source for a limited time window.
Detect via inspection of UDP/9 payloads containing WOL patterns and sudden SSH acceptance.
